Present Illness.Onset: Started suddenly 2 weeks ago at home, no obvious prodrome, possible trigger unknown
Present Illness.Main Symptoms: Red, itchy skin rashes on wrists, forearms, and neck; papules and occasional blisters; symptoms worsen with scratching and slightly improve with topical creams
Present Illness.Accompanying Symptoms: Mild swelling and lichenification in areas of persistent scratching, no fever or systemic symptoms
Present Illness.Diagnosis and Treatment History: Applied over-the-counter hydrocortisone cream with partial relief, no prior consultation before admission
Present Illness.General Condition Changes: Normal mental state, slightly disturbed sleep due to itching, normal appetite, no change in urination and defecation, stable weight

Past History.General Health Condition: Generally healthy for age, chronic hypertension managed with medication
Past History.Disease History: Hypertension for 15 years, no history of diabetes or significant chronic illnesses
Past History.Infectious Disease History: No history of significant infectious diseases
Past History.Immunization History: Up-to-date with vaccinations, including influenza and pneumonia
Past History.Surgery and Trauma History: Appendectomy at age 25, no significant trauma history

Personal History.Living Habits: Non-smoker, drinks alcohol occasionally, balanced diet
Personal History.Occupation and Working Conditions: Retired, previously worked as a teacher
Personal History.Exposure History: No known exposure to industrial toxins, dust, or radioactive substances

Marital History.Spouse's Health Condition: Passed away due to natural causes

Marital and Family History.Family History: Father had hypertension, mother was generally healthy, no siblings

Systematic Examination.Skin: Erythematous rashes on wrists, forearms, and neck with papules, occasional blisters, and lichenification
Systematic Examination.Head and Organs: Normocephalic, atraumatic, normal vision and hearing
Systematic Examination.Chest: Clear breath sounds, no wheezing or crackles; normal heart sounds, no murmurs
Systematic Examination.Limbs: No clubbing or cyanosis, normal range of motion
Systematic Examination.Nervous System: Alert and oriented, normal reflexes and motor strength

Hospitalization Record.Specialist Examination: Dermatology consult: consistent with dermatitis, further evaluation needed to rule out differential diagnoses
Hospitalization Record.Auxiliary Examination: CBC: WBC 7.2 x 10^3/µL, Eosinophils 5%; Skin biopsy: pending results
Hospitalization Record.Diagnostic Basis: Clinical presentation of itchy erythematous rashes, history of partial relief with topical treatment, physical examination findings
Hospitalization Record.Differential Diagnosis: Atopic dermatitis: less likely due to onset in elderly; Contact dermatitis: possible but no clear exposure; Seborrheic dermatitis: unlikely due to distribution; Others: ruled out based on history and examination

Post-Admission Course Records.First Course Record: Admitted for evaluation and management of dermatitis. Differential includes contact dermatitis, atopic dermatitis, and other eczematous conditions. Plan: Continue hydrocortisone, initiate oral antihistamines, consult dermatology for further evaluation
Post-Admission Course Records.Daily Course Records: 10th February: Slight improvement in itching, no new lesions; 11th February: Dermatology saw the patient, recommended patch testing for allergens
Post-Admission Course Records.Senior Physician Rounds Records: Reviewed case, agrees with current plan, monitor for response to treatment
Post-Admission Course Records.Handover Records: Patient stable, to continue current management, pending patch test results
Post-Admission Course Records.Consultation Records: Dermatology consult on 11th February, recommendations: patch testing, continue topical and oral treatments

Medical Orders.Long-term Orders: Topical hydrocortisone cream, apply twice daily; Oral antihistamine once daily at bedtime
Medical Orders.Temporary Orders: Skin biopsy, pending results; Patch testing for allergens

Hospitalization Record.Auxiliary Examination Reports: Skin biopsy result: spongiotic dermatitis, consistent with eczematous conditions; Patch test: pending
Hospitalization Record.Temperature Chart: Temperature stable, 36.6°C; Pulse stable, 72 bpm; Respiration stable, 16 breaths/min; Blood pressure stable, 130/80 mmHg

Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Ti.Name: Dermatitis
Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Ti.Symptoms: Skin rashes, papules, blisters, lichenification, etc.
Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Ti.Differential Diagnosis: Atopic dermatitis, contact dermatitis, seborrheic dermatitis, stasis dermatitis, neurodermatitis, superficial fungal infections, scabies, polymorphic light eruption, eosinophilia syndrome, pellagra, etc.
